attributes.action: Improve the terms and conditions of employment for general practice nurses
attributes.additional_details: It is suggested that a 1/3 of all nurses working in general practice plan to retire by 2020 (Cummings, 2017; QNI, 2016).  Both; General Practice – Developing confidence, capability and capacity (NHS England, 2017) and General Practice Nursing (GPN) Workforce Development Plan – Recognise, Rethink and Reform (HEE, 2017), are encouraging responses, however neither address the “elephant in the room”. Pay and conditions are central to the recruitment and retention of GPN’s and must be addressed.
attributes.background: General Practice Nurses (GPN’s) are not directly employed by the NHS and so a great deal of disparity exists amongst the pay and employment conditions offered by individual employers. Some GPN’s cannot access training and receive only statutory levels of sick pay, maternity pay and annual leave.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about the terms and conditions for GPNs, but we're not sure what specific improvements you'd like to see. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
